result.execSummary:
The defendant Carrington J Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Conspiracy to Commit Possession of a Firearm by a Felon
Conspiracy to Commit Possession of a Firearm by a Felon (Furnishing a Firearm to a Felon)

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT: Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Concurrent with: *2-9-2021/Judge J.D. Watts; Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include a total of 158 days of sentence credit on count three and count four.*
with 157 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 4 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Concurrent with: *2-9-2021/Judge J.D. Watts; Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include a total of 158 days of sentence credit on count three and count four.*
with 157 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 3 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carrington J Smith in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Defendant Carrington J Smith in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS with 157 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 4 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

As to Count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 157 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 3 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
PSI received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.
At the request of DOC, sentencing date is moved from 11/23/2016 to 12/01/2016 for completion of PSI.

Defendant Carrington J Smith in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Defendant Carrington J Smith in custody.  Dennis P Coffey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, Counts 1 & 2 are DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Counts 3 & 4: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests more time to obtain a global offer.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carrington J Smith not in court.  Kim Schoepp for Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Carrington J Smith in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Defendant Carrington J Smith in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court is informed that the defendant has been charged with 12 new offenses, 16CF2736, which is set for preliminary hearing on 7-5-2015 at 1:30pm.  The defense is asking for a continuation of the trial which is set for 7-5-2016 at 8:15am in this court.  The state has no objection to a continuance.  The court will set this matter for a pretrial on 7-19-2016 at 8:15 and perhaps  global resolution can be done.
The court orders the $5000.00 cash bail on deposit forfeited and sets new cash bail of $25,000.00.  Defense counsel asks that the court not forfeit the bail currently on deposit and just increase it to $25,000.00 which the court declines to do.
Atty Coffey may ask the court to reconsider the bail at the next court date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Motion for Continuance filed by defense.  Motion to be heard on 6-30-2016 at 8:15.  Atty Coffey to advise ADA Hayes to appear.

Defendant Carrington J Smith in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for Karl Hayes for the State of Wisconsin.  The court is informed that the defendant no longer wishes to resolve this case by acceptance of the state's offer and wants to proceed to trial on 7-5-2016.

Defendant Carrington J Smith in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury trial set for  at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 4-7-2016.
